com.ibm.xmi.framework
Class AdapterFactory

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.xmi.framework.AdapterFactory
public class AdapterFactory
extends java.lang.Object

The framework uses this class to create instances of reader and writer adapters. You can subclass this class and register an instance of your subclass if you want the framework to use your own adapters rather than the default implementations.

The framework uses a ReaderAdapter when an XMI file is loaded.

The framework uses an ObjectWriterAdapter to write XMI files. The framework also uses an ObjectWriterAdapter when loading with an XMIFiles object, because it uses the getID method of the ObjectWriterAdapter to get ids to handle cross-file referenes.

The framework uses a DeclarationWriterAdapter to write DTDs and schemas.

If you subclass this class, use the AdapterFactoryRegister class to register your own adapter factory with the framework.

Method Detail

createReaderAdapter

public ReaderAdapter createReaderAdapter()
If you subclass this class, return an object that is an instance of your own implementation of the ReaderAdapter interface. This method returns a ReaderAdapterImpl, which is the default implementation of the ReaderAdapter interface.
Returns:
A ReaderAdapterImpl

createObjectWriterAdapter

public ObjectWriterAdapter createObjectWriterAdapter()
If you subclass this class, return an object that is an instance of your own implementation of the ObjectWriterAdapter interface. This method returns a ObjectWriterAdapterImpl, which is the default implementation of the ObjectWriterAdapter interface.
Returns:
A ObjectWriterAdapterImpl

createDeclarationWriterAdapter

If you subclass this class, return an object that is an instance of your own implementation of the WriterAdapter interface. This method returns a DeclarationWriterAdapterImpl, which is the default implementation of the DeclarationWriterAdapter interface.
Returns:
A DeclarationWriterAdapterImpl
